ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned to practice my spanish.

I learned how to write coherently in Spanish and how to meaningfully engage in Spanish conversations. I learned about cultural aspects of the Spanish-speaking world through watching short videos and reading short texts in class.
I improved my conversational spanish skills
How to apply what we learned in class to cultural concepts and how to discuss short-films in Spanish.
I continued to work on my Spanish language skills. This included learning new grammatical structures, vocabulary, and cultural topics from Spanish speaking countries.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I think that the overall class engagement level was low and could be improved by more small group projects in class.

Professor Baffi was the strength of this class! She was super supportive and helpful on every assignment. Her passion for Spanish and her students is so clear in everything she doesI'll miss her a lot next semester!
the array of content is a major strength!

strength: focuses on building up your confidence when speaking Spanish
weakness: doesn't focus heavily on grammar
The flexibility in projects and creativity of assignments

I enjoyed thus course. I thought Prof. Baffi was awesome, and I wish I could have her for L4 as well. I think that the class was very worksheet heavy  I enjoyed when we were able to engage with more authentic media from Spanish speaking countries.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, you must take it if you want to complete spanish.

I'd recommend Spanish 130 to another student who is willing to put in the work. It can be a daunting amount of work at times, but you really get out what you put in. I know that it's a requirement for a lot of people, but take it!!
Yes if you're looking for the language requirement
Yes, you learn a lot and it is very engaging
I would recommend it. I am taking it to fulfill my language requirement, but I also enjoy learning a new language and would probably take Spanish even if I didn't have to.
